extracted_data.oldest_reference_title: Note on census-taking in Monte Carlo calculations
extracted_data.citation_claim: The origins of Quantum Monte Carlo methods are often attributed to Enrico Fermi and Robert Richtmyer who developed in 1948 a mean-field particle interpretation of neutron-chain reactions.[37]
extracted_data.citation_accuracy_assessment: accurate — The reference is Fermi and Richtmyer's 1948 Los Alamos report on Monte Carlo calculations (census-taking methods for neutron-chain reactions), which directly supports the article's claim that they developed a mean-field particle interpretation of neutron-chain reactions in 1948.
